critique: This document amends Executive Order No. 10789, focusing on indemnification agreements for contractors, particularly concerning unusually hazardous or nuclear risks. It outlines conditions under which the United States will hold harmless and indemnify contractors against claims or losses, specifying the types of claims covered and excluding those caused by willful misconduct or lack of good faith. The amendment also addresses procedures for notice and control in settlement or defense of claims. The document reflects a concern for managing risks associated with government contracts, especially in high-risk areas, and aims to provide a framework for indemnification while safeguarding against misconduct.
